extendedInfo.description: Be ready for a wildfire with Wildfire by the American Red Cross. Get notified about active wildfires, as well as fire weather warnings, prepare your family, home and pets, let loved ones know that you are safe even if the power is out â a must have for anyone who lives in an area that is susceptible to wildfires or has loved ones that do. -- Featured by Firechief.com (11/14/12)-- Featured by Wildlandfireleadership.com (10/2012)-- American Red Cross Releases 'Wildfires' App, Helps You Keep Your Cool When Things Get Hot â AndroidPolice-- One of the top 51 new Android apps â AndrioidPolice (10/2012)--Red Cross Wild App Brigs Help at the Touch of a Screen â Occupational Health and Safety online-- Red Cross Wildfire App Brings Help at the Touch of a Screen â ShetechonlineFeatures: â¢ Step-by-step instructions let you know what to do even before/during/after wildfires, even if no data connectivity. â¢ Wildfire News section with state-by-state links to all fire-fighting agenciesâ Twitter feeds and websites ensuring the most recent developments on current wildfires. â¢ Click-to-call access to your stateâs 511 network for the latest traffic information in case of evacuation â¢ Let family and friends know you are okay with the customizable âIâm Safeâ alert for Facebook, Twitter, email and text. â¢ Find open Red Cross shelters in your area when you need help. â¢ Stay safe when the lights are out with the Toolkit, including a strobe light, flashlight and audible alert functions. â¢ Prepare for the worst by learning how to assemble an emergency kit for your family in the event of power outage or evacuation. â¢ Empower your family to stay safe and remain calm in an emergency by learning how to make and practice an emergency plan. â¢ Earn badges that you can share with your friends and show off your wildfire knowledge with interactive quizzes. -- Permissions --DIRECTLY CALL PHONE NUMBERS: We need this to allow you to call emergency numbers from within the appCAMERA: We need to be able to use the camera to allow us to use the flashlight in Tool KitGPS LOCATION: We need to serve you wildfire alerts based on your current locationPHONE CONTACTS: We need this for the Make a Plan view to allow you to add emergency contacts straight from your address book

reviews.title: Red cross fire app
reviews.comment: Before it was changed to what it is now it was usefull being a redcross volinter. Now it is useless to us the app is imformation only. I cant find any thing about real fires in our or any place it does not tell us where the fires are or its statis. Will add 4stars when it is fixted
reviews.author: Richard Kolar

reviews.title: Tool best for our needs .
reviews.comment: A real good app to help you out with different resources and has great free maps , a flash light , a siren , all really great things to help u in an emergency found it to be a great tool for my needs .
reviews.author: Peter Bohan

reviews.title: Wildfire -- American Red Cross
reviews.comment: App is useful. Would be better if map actually showed my location (Missouri) instead of somewhere off the coast of Africa
reviews.author: Sue Edwards

reviews.title: App is OK, but...
reviews.comment: I have a house within 7 miles of a fire and family directly in the path of the fire. When there is an active fire, you cannot read the entire description of where the fire is actually located. The description gets truncated and cannot be expanded. Also cannot limit area of where to receive alarms. Getting alarms from areas I do not need to know about.   Will give 5 stars when fixed.
reviews.author: Martin Bush

reviews.title: No longer useful.
reviews.comment: They have \"expired\" the alert feature and the location monitor.  Without these,  what is the point of the app?  USELESS!
reviews.author: Dan Chancellor

reviews.title: Alert
reviews.comment: Keep the fire alert instead of news its almost useless without the alerts for your area
reviews.author: Megan Laatsch

reviews.title: Good resource!
reviews.comment: Overall great app but the map in the alerts always shows Africa even though that is not where the fire is.
reviews.author: Becky Odle

reviews.title: Good but....
reviews.comment: Descriptions are all truncated - cannot see more than about the first sentence. Really sucks since I then have to go elsewhere to get the full story. Please get this fixed!
reviews.author: Chris Stone

reviews.title: Current location faulty
reviews.comment: There is no way to link to mobile phone GPS to  monitor location while traveling. Makes app rather useless.
reviews.author: Elise Moore

reviews.title: Lacks Critical, Real-Time Content
reviews.comment: I love the entire suite of Red Cross apps.  Overall I find them clean, useful, and well-designed.  Unfortunately, the Wildfire app is a bit lacking in its content.  As I write this, the Fisher Fire just south of Flagstaff, AZ is 50% contained.  The fire was reported well over 24 hours ago.  Fortunately @AzEIN has been tweeting real time updates.  Great apps, but the content needs to be more inclusive and updated much more quickly in order for the app to be considered relevant.  This is the difference between a true emergency app and a mere news app.  Look forward to seeing the next update.
reviews.author: Aaron Wells

reviews.title: SUCKS
reviews.comment: Terrible, it alerts me to wild fires in other states not in my monitored location
reviews.author: Becky Knox

reviews.title: Omg Slow notifications
reviews.comment: Notifications r slow.  Get notifications after fire is out!  Knew of fires locally way before app.  App doesn\'t redirect to follow the fires activity and doesn\'t take u to fs sites.
reviews.author: Barbara Hamilton

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment: Addendum, after they  messed with it more it still does not work. Typical red cross. Would give it negative stars if I could.    I downloaded the app, set the two locations I wanted (az and co) made the radius watched smaller and now I get alerts for California and Alaska. None for where I want. Then if I go to the map to see where the fire might be it always shows that Africa yes AFRICA is burning. What a useless app
reviews.author: Kevin Case

reviews.title: Needs updated.
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t seem to be a bad app overall, however with changes they made as of the 3rd of July 2013 no longer has locations or location tracking so until update comes cant track any fires near you
reviews.author: Bobby Pont

reviews.title: Not good
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t work at all there\'s a fire near by and nothing about it
reviews.author: p thomas

reviews.title: Maps are buggy
reviews.comment: This could be a handy app, but the maps are all messed up. Fires are all shown off the west coast of Africa. Even ones in Wyoming.....?
reviews.author: Stan Grabowski

reviews.title: Seriously?
reviews.comment: Why would you disable the maps and alerts without having the replacement up and running first?  And why would you do this right in the middle of fire season??  Please fix ASAP!
reviews.author: Greg Freeman

reviews.title: No Alerts = No Value
reviews.comment: Alerts didn\'t work well. Now instead of fixing, its been deleted. App no longer has any use. Uninstalling.
reviews.author: Martin Batistelli

reviews.title: when do they post there\'s a fire
reviews.comment: there\'s a fire in Ada county in Boise Idaho this is one of the places that I have for alerts it started 7/1/13 about 5pm they have yet still to post it on this site
reviews.author: Ron Wilson

reviews.title: misinformation in app.
reviews.comment: Mapping function is horrible. Uninstalled until it\'s fixed. I am a fire manager.  Wildfires occur in every state of the union. Granted the West has a higher propensity for damaging fire the potential is anywhere you have tall grass and woodlands. In the West, lighting in the primary cause, but in the east, arson is the number one cause. The map locator doesn\'t work and is showing test data from Inciweb.
reviews.author: Wm Glesener
